reviews.review: are you guys going trick or treating?

No random crits, straight 10/10.

Jokes aside, this game is an extremely fun classic of its genre, which preceded the extremely successful sequel; Team Fortress 2. 

After playing a couple dozen hours, both Online, and Offline with bots, I can safely say that I find this game to actually be [i]more fun[/i] than TF2.
Despite its outdated graphics, it's seriously not that bad and it's very playable, although you might just as well pass up on it if graphics were the sole reason you played video games.

A sad fact is that it's not nearly as popular as it should be [i](although it's not as close to being dead as a lot of people claim it to be)[/i], considering how fun it is; there's only around 140 players playing a day, roughly half of which are players who likely got it by mistake. Most of these players don't have any idea what to do or how things work, and who most of the time don't even know how to change their name or use chat, meaning that, sadly, most of these players leave and never come back to try playing again.
If you do happen to run into the rare actual players, they are usually quite wholesome people you can have a nice game with, regardless whether you're on the same team as them.

Truth being told, it's never exactly been friendly for new players, at least not to those who don't make a habit of looking through all the options first, before actually trying to play, and a large portion of the incoming audience is actually made up from TF2 players, who, obnoxious most of them are, obviously come in expecting TF2 gameplay.

I am not going to sugarcoat it here: Just because [i]you[/i] can't understand the game's basic mechanics, it doesn't necessarily mean they're complicated. The classes are constructed differently, and the developers were so kind as to actually provide you with [i]a complete manual[/i] on how to play each and every class, [i][b]in detail[/b][/i]; and it's your problem if you can't read simple text. You have to learn how to play a completely new game, so swallow your damn pride and accept the help you're offered.

Speaking of the game, the RNG that I absolutely [i]hate[/i] about TF2 is absent here. This means that the game won't cheat you out of your victory just because of some dated bullsh*t mechanic that has no reason to exist, and is a downright terrible design choice. The gameplay has a similar degree of chaos as the sequel, albeit a little more organised, but the real thing that makes me choose this over TF2 is the more serious, realistic setting and aesthetic, and a more reasonable degree of variety, which the other game has taken to the point where it simply repels me.

If you're the type of person who is into old-school games, and who is as thorough as a normal person would be, then you'll feel at home.
I have absolutely no regrets after buying it, just be prepared not to meet too many players along the way. You can help expand the active playerbase by buying it.

While the game IS outdated somewhat, Team Fortress Classic is a very nice game. So, I'll be reviewing it!

THE CONTROLS:

First off, the controls are simple, but JUST IN CASE.... MAKE SURE TO CHECK THE CONTROLS BEFORE YOU PLAY! THEY ARE NOTHING LIKE TF2's CONTROLS!

GAMEPLAY:

While many people think this game is AND I QUOTE: "Dead", The game still has a huge player base and I was able to find a server really quickly with over 12 players in it and I had a good time.

You play as one of 10! YES! THAT'S RIGHT 10 CLASSES!

Lets get the 10th Class out of the way. The Civilian. exclusive to the VIP game mode. his only attack is weak, meaning if you're a Civilian, it's best to stick with the team and not go on ahead. 

as for the other classes, Don't expect all of them to play like their TF2 Counterparts.

MAPS

THERE ARE HUNDREDS OF MAPS THANKS TO MODDED SERVERS! but almost all of them are good...

RECOMMENDED MODS

Like other Source games, TFC has mods! these ones are mainly made to make the game LOOK better or make it more like the Beta version.

FINAL SCORE:

Controls: 4/5
Gameplay: 5/5
Maps: 5/5
Mods: 4/5
FINAL SCORE: 18/20 Would recommend.

Bought this back in 2018 and I didn't know what to expect. I'm posting this review as of July 2021 because this is the only game that I haven't touched yet. So I played, and it was fun! The game features fast-paced combat with a variety of characters to choose from. For a 90s game, it still holds up until today.
